resources.file: assets/image/Flat Bar Red Fill Bar Buffer.png.png
resources.name: Flat Bar Red Fill Bar Buffer.png

events.comment:
At the beginning of the scene we create the transion shape painter and start the transition effect (using transition extension)
and we set the global variable to False (to re set the player mode back to 1 player)

Button events, we check if cursor is on the button, and the button effect is not enabled (to trigger this event once)
and we check if the number of living instnaces of the transition objects is 0 (to not allow the player pressing any other button while hte transition is going)

then we enable the button effect

if mouse left button is pressed and the cursor is on the button
we change the button animation to Pressed and we create and start the transition

same as "1Player" events, but for another button, but here, when the player press on 2 Players button, we set the global variable to True (we will use this variable in Game scene, to check if this is a 2 players or 1 player mode)
same as "1Player" events, but for another button

Buffer.texture: Flat Bar Red Fill Bar Buffer.png
Flat Bar Red Fill Bar Buffer.png
Flat Bar Red Fill Bar Buffer.png

events.comment: In this events below, we just create the light objects at the beginning of the scene

if the global variable is false (its set to True or False from the main menu)
then we create player 1 related objects

if the global variable is true (means the player is in 2 players mode)
then we create all objects related to player 1 and 2

as soon as the transition finish, we delete the transition object and we wait 1 second (to give time for the player character to move into the map (refer to "Player mechanics/moving into map"))
then we set the variable to True (means the game has started)
We change the light color each time it is at frame 0 or 1 (each frame got its own light color)

all level lights object are flicking smoothly, to make t super smooth, we use (sin) expression:
We use Time variable to store the Time delta (required for sine expression to work)
then we set the light variable set to the range i want the light radius to go from to smoothly
in here we set 155+ 35 then we multiply it with sin the variable time delta
i want the light radius to move back and forth smoothly between the numbers 190 then 120 then 190 and so on, so we use this math:
(light range 190 → 120)
155: (190 + 120) / 2 = 155
35: (190 - 120) / 2 = 35

same thing for StreetLightSmooth variable, but the range is different here
here, we just change the light radius set to the variable above

events.name: Camera and map parts detector and walls creation

events.comment: at the beginning of the scene, we create the wall object and hide it then we give it a variable and set its number to 1 (it means this wall is the right wall for stage 1)

here we check, the number of dead enemies, if its equal to 2 (means the first 2 enemies in stage 1 has died)
and we check the wall variable (we set above) if its equal to 1 (we use this condition to be able to pick the right wall instances)
then we delete that wall (so the player can move to the next stage on the right)
same as above, but here we start checking if the player is in 1 player mode or 2 players mode

same as above but here we check if the player global variable is false (means the player is in 1 player mode)
then we check if the X position of player 1 is greater than 640 (means the player has moved all the way to stage 2)
then we create the wall on the right side of stage 2, and set the wall variable number to 2
if the global variable is true (means the player is in 2 players mode)
we check if both players are alive (variable is false)

then we check if both players X position is greater than 640 (means both players is at stage 2 now)
then we create the wall
same as above but here we check if player 1 is dead (variable is true) and player 2 is alive (variable is false)
then we check if player 2 x position is greater than 640
same as above, but here we check if player 1 is alive and player 2 is dead (variable is true)
then we check if player 1 x position is greater than 640, then we create the wall

same as "Stage 1" here we check if the number of dead enemies is euqla to 6 (2 from stage one + 4 from stage two = 6)
then we pick the wall (number 2),and we delete that wall (to allow the players to go for stage 3)
same as above but for different stage

here we just pick the wall at this X and Y position and we set its variable number to 4
nothing else to check because this is the final stage wall, so no need to check for how many dead enemies are there, like we did above

here we just check if player x position is greater than 640
then we tween the camera to stage 2 x position
and we create a wall on the left side (so player no longer can go back to stage 1)
and we set the variable to 2 (means the player is at stage 2 now)
and we delete ThisWayArrow object (if its still there)

same as 1 player mode, but here we check if player 1 and 2 is alive (variable is false)
then we check the x position of both player objects
same as above, but here we check if player 1 is dead and player 2 is alive
here we check if player 1 is alive and player 2 is dead

when resume button animation is finished, we delete the all objectes related to pause menu
then we resume the music on channel 0 and we set the time scale back to 1
when replay button animation is finished, we create and start the transition
when the transition is finished, we change the scene to Game
same as Replay button, but here when the transition finish, we change the scene to MainMenu scene

if mouse left button is pressed and the cursor is on pause button
and the game has started (variable is true)
and game is not finished (variable is false)
and the layer time scale is not 0 (mean the game is not paused)

then we change the pause button animation to pressed, and we set the layer itme scale to 0
then we create all objects related to pause menu
we changet he pause button animation back to idle when the Pressed animation has finished (so the player can use the pause button again)

we check if the player is at stage 1, and number of dead enemies are 2 (means the player has finished stage 1)
then we create ThisWayArrow object on UI layer
and we flash it for 1.3seconds (using flash extension)
and we play a sound, and start a timer (we use this timer to delete the object, refer to the event below)
same as above but for stage 2
same as above but for stage 3
whenever the object timer is greater than 1.8seconds, we delete that object (you can increase that number if you want to make the arrow stay for longer time)

events.name: Moving to map at the beginning of the game

events.comment: If the game didnt start yet (variable is false)
if the player is in 1 player mode (variable is false) then we simulate pressing right for player 1
if the player is in 2 players mode (variable is false) then we simulate pressing right for player 1 and 2
if the game has started
we check if any player is in collision with any wall, then we separate the player from the wall
same as above, but here we check if the barrel animation is not Broke (to not separate the player form the broken barrel), then we separate the player from barrel
depending on the player mode, we just chang the player shadow position set to the player position

everytime the player animation is Move, and the sprite is 0 or 5 (i set 0 and 5 because at this frames, the player leg is at the floor)
and the x position is less than 2592 (this mean the player x position is less than stage 4) (we use this condition to avoid the footstep sound effects from player when the player finish the game and keep going to right)
then we create the footstep particles at player position and we set its z order to the player z order + 1
same as above but for 2 players

we check, if the player z order is not equal to the playercollison box top, and the player is not knocked down (variable is false)
then we change the player shadow z order set to player zorder-1
and player zorder set to player1collisionbox top
same as above but for 2 players
we change the player1 X position set to player 1collisionbox Xposition

here, we first check, if the player is not jumping, not dead, and not respawning (variables are false)
and player 1 is not jumping, then we change the Y position set to the player 1 collision box Y position
(we use this variables because we dont want player 1 skin Y position to change to the collision box while its jumping, we want the player to be bale to jump, so we dont trigger this event while the player is jumping, or dead, or any other actions like respawning)

if player died, and the player timer is greater than 0.56 (means the player felt on the floor, and now its time to stop him from falling)
then we change the player skin Y position set to to player1collision box Y position

we check if player animation is not Punch2/1/kick/hurt/jumpkick/movejumpkick  (because we dont want this event to trigger while any of this animations is running)
and the player is not dead and not respawning (variables are false)
then we check if player is not jumping, and is on floor (we use point inside object condition to check if the player is on the floor)
andw e check if player is moving, then we set the player animation to Move
same as above but here we check if player is not moving, then we change the animation to idle
if player is jumping we change the animation to Jump

events.name: Cant move while kicking in air

events.comment:
this events below, to not allow the player to be able to move back while kicking in air.
we check if player animation is MoveJumpKick or JumpKick

we check, if player is not horizontally flipped
and the variable CantMoveLeft is false

then we change the variable to True
same as above but for CantMoveRight variable

here we check, if any of the variables above are true, and the player animation is not Movejumpkick and not JumpKick
then we set both variables to false (to be able to trigger the events above again)

we check if the player animation is not punch2/1/kick/hurt (to not allow the player to move while one of this animations are running)
and player is not dead or respawning (variables are false)
if W key is pressed, we move the player up

if D key is pressed, and cant move right is false (we set this variable from the event above "Cant move while kicking in air") (we use this variable to not allow the player to move right if he was kicking in air to left side)
then we move the player right

if the player is flipped, and the animation is not kick/jumpkick/movejumpkick (to not allow the player to flip while kicking in air, or on floor)
then we dont flip the player horizontally
same as above but for moving left
S key is pressed, we move the player down

if K key is pressed
and player animation is not Punch1/2/kick/hurt (to not allow the player to jump while any of this animations are running)
and player is not jumping and cantjump and not dead and not respawning (variables are false)
and player is on floor (we use point inside object to check if player is on floor)
Then, we disale player2 collision box Platform behavior (to avoid player 1 colliding with player 2 platform)
and we set the variable to True (we use this variable to check when to enable player 2 platform behavior again)
then we allow the player to jump again (in case the playerCollisionBox platform behavior was off, we allow the player to jump while in air)
then simulate jump for the player and we set the variable PlayerIsJumping to True
and cant jump to true (we use this variable to not allow Holding K key to always jump, but jump after the key being released and pressed again)
then we start a timer for the player object

This event here is used to fix a bug where (if both players pressed Jump key exactly in the same time, both players will fall form the platform because both players collison box platform behavior will be off)
so this event here will check if the player bottom is Greater than the collision box top, and the timer is less or equal to 0.5seconds (this timer we started from above, means the player is jumping)
then we allow the player to jump again, and then we simulate jump key (so now as soon as the player start falling, he will immeidatly jump normaly)

here we check, if the player is jumping (variable is true)
and the timer is greater or equal to 0.5s
and player is on floor (we use point is inside object to check if player is on floor)
then we set the PlayerJumping variable to false, and we delete the timer (we use the timer here, to not allow this event to run before 0.5seconds, without the timer, as soon as the player jump, this event will run immediatly, and not allow him to jump, so the timer is here to fix this)

this 2 events below will check, if player1 is in collision with player2Collisonbox (platform) then we will disable player2 collison box platform behavior (we dont want player 1 to move inside player 2 platform, it will caus weird animation bugs (because you are moving a platformer character player inside a wall))
same as above, but here we check if player is not in collision with player2 collision box, then we enable player 2 collison box platform behavior

This event is used to enable/disable player2 collision box Platform behavior, to not allow player1 to collide with player 2 Platform (wall).

we check if variable (we set from the events above) is true
and player is not jumping and can jump (variables are false)
and player is not in collision with player 2 collision box
then we enable player 2 platform behavior, and we set the variable back to false (to trigger this event once)

here we check, if the variable is false
and player is in collision with player 2 collision box,
then we disbale Platform behavior from Player2CollisionBox
and we set the variable to true, to start the event above
when K key is released, we set the variable to false (so now the player can Jump again if he wants)

If J key is pressed, and player animation is not kick/hurt (to not allow the player to punch while the player is kicking or hurt)
and the player can punch (variable is false)
and player is not dead and not respawning (variable are false)
and the game has started (variable is true)
and the player is on floor (we use point is inside object to check if player is on floor)
then we set the player variable to false (we use this variable to be able to damage the enemies whenever the variable is false)
then we add 1 to player variable (this variable is used to count which punch animation to go for)
and we start a timer (this timer is used to reset the player animation back to idlea fter punching)
for every enemy, we set its variable to false (means this enemy can take damage)

for every barrel, we check if the player center X position is less than the barrel center X position, and player is not flipped (menas the player is on the left side of the barrel and the player is not flipped (looking right)) then we set the barrel to take damage (variable false)
same as above, but here we check if player is on right side of barrel and flipped (looking left)

we check, if the variable punch number (we set from the event above) is = to 1
then we change the player animation to punch 1 and change the variable to true (this variable is used to trigger this event once every time its triggered)
same as above, but here we check if the punch number is 2, then we change the player animation to punch 2, and set the variable to true
and here, we set the punch number back to 0 (to make the player start over from punch number 1)

if the player timer is greater or equal to 0.3s, then we set the punch number to 0 and delete the timer (this event is used to make the player make Punch number 1 then 2 only under 0.3s , increasing the timer time, will give the player more time to go from punch 1 → idle → punch 2, in our event, we gave him 0.3seconds to got from punch 1 to punch 2, other wise it will reset back to punch 1)
when the J key is released, we set the player variable to false (to make the events above trigger again)

if the player animation punch1 or 2 has finished
we change the player animation back to idle
same as Punch events, but here for kick, and we dont add a variable to increase the number like we did in Punch events, because we only have 1 kick animation
This event is used to damage the enemy ONLY when the kick animation is at frame 2 (because we dont want the enemy to take damage while the player leg is still launching)
same as floor kick events, but here we check if player is not on floor, and player movement is not equal to 0 (menas the player is moving while in air)
same events as Move jump kick, but here we check if player speed on X is equal to 0 (means the player is not moving)
exact same events as "1Player mode" but we check for player2 object rather than player1 object

events.name: Cant move while kicking in air
Cant move while kicking in air
Who is the last attacked enemy

events.comment: we check if the variable is true (this variable is used to trigger this event once, everytime its triggered)

we check, if the number of enemies in the scene is greater than 1, and the enemies are not dead or hurt, then we set all enemies variable to false, and we set the event variable to false (to stop this event)
why we set the enemy variables to false ? because when the player punch an enemy (you will see that in the group events below) we set that enemy (ThisIsTheLastAttackedEnemy) variable to true and we set this event variable to true
so what will happen is, the enemy that got punhced, will have his variable set to true, while the rest of all ohter enemies set to false (this event set them to false)

we check if the number of enmeies is less or equal to 1, then we set the variable to false (to turn this event off because there is no enemies around to set their variables to false, the only enemy is the one with the variable true (the one that got punched))
exactly the same as above, but here we check if player2 is punching

events.name: Who is the last enemy that punched the player

events.comment: same as above, but here we check who is the last enemy that punched the player

for each instance of enemy, if player animation is Punch1 or 2 or the player animation is kick and at frame 2
and the distance between the player and enemy is below 40 (player is close to the enemy)
and the y position of the player is greater than the enemy y pos and less than enemy bottom position (we use this 2 Y conditions to make the player only able to punch the enemies that is close to them on the Y position, without this conditions, the player will be able to punch the enemies even if he is below them or above them)
and if the enemy is not knocked down, and can take damage (variables are false)
and enemy animation is not dead

if player is not flipped (looking right)
and enemy center x position is greater than player center x position (means the enemy is on the right side of the player)
then we set the enemy variable to true (to take damage)
and we turn off the enemy behavior (to stop the enemy from moving when taking damage)
and change the enemy animation to Hurt, and shake the enemy on the X position (using Shake extension)
and we create the damaging effect shape painter (using shockwave extension behavior)
and we subtract 8 from enemy health variable
and we add 1 to enemy KnockdownCount variable (we use this variable to knock down the enemy, when the variable is higher than a random number in range (you will see that in "knockdown" group event))
and we start a timer for the enemy (so the enemy AI mechanics can start again after the time)
then we set the enemy variable to true (last attacked enemy), to know that this is the last attacked enemy (we use this to create the correct health bar for the right enemy, you will see that in enemy health events)
and we trigger the variable CheckWhoIsTheLastAttackedEnemy (variable set to true)
and we set the player variable CantDamageEnemies set to true (to not spam punches every frame)
and we set the enemy variable CantTakeDamage to true (so this even work once every time its triggered)
and we set the enemy variable to true (TakingDamageFromPlayer1) (we used this variable to check from who the enemy is taking damage, player 1 or 2)

same as above but we check if player is flipped (looking left)
and the enemy center x position is less than player center x position (means the enemy is on the left side of the player)
Same as above, but for Player2
same events as "From Punch and floor kick" above, but for player Kick in air aniamtion
same events as above, but for player2

same events as "From Punch and floor kick" above, but here for player JumpKick animation
and to make this move more fun, we made the player immediatly knockdown the enemy if the enemy is hit with this AirJumpKick
so this events is the same as above, but in the actions, we set the enemy (Knockdown) variable set to True, to kockdown the enemy
same as above but for player2

for each instances of enemy
we check if the enemy is taking damage (variable is true), and not knockeddown (variable is false)
and the timer of the enemy is greater than 0.6seconds
then we activate the enemy pathfinding behavior again (so the enemy can move again)
and we change the animation back to idle
and we move the enemy to its position (we added this action to stop the enemy from moving back to his old pathfind target, so this action make sure to stop him completly)
then we set the knockdown count back to 0, and we reset all other variables back to default (0 and false)
and finally we delete the timer
we check if player1 health bar vlue is not equal to player1 health variable, then we change the value of the health bar set to the player health variable
same thing but for player 2
here we just change the player lives text set to the player lives variable
we check if the player is knockeddown (variable is true)

if the player timer is greater than 1.5seconds, we flash the player for 1.2seconds then we start a timer to check when the flash has finished, and we delete the other timer (to trigger this event once everytime its triggered)

when the timer (started from event above) is greater or equal to 1.5seconds
we delete the player

here we check, if the player lives is not equal to 0 (otherwise it means game over)
we set the timer to spawn the player again

here we check, if the player lives is equal to 0 (means game over)
then we play the game over sound and we set the game finished variable to true
then we wait 4.7seconds (to give time for the game over sound to finish)
then we create and start the transition to main menu
we check if the player is in 2 players mode (global variable is true)

we check, if player 1 lives is 0
and player 2 lives is not 0, or player2 health is greater than 0 (means player 2 is still alive)
then we set player 1 variable to true (to tell the game that player 1 is now dead and cant respawn, only player 2 is alive)
and we make all enemies focus on player 2 (refer to "enemy mechanics → AI actions" to understand this variable more)

here we check, if player 1 is dead, and player 2 is dead, and player 2 health is less or equal to 0 (means both players are dead now)
then we start the lose sound and we set the variable to true, then we wait 4.7seconds and we create and start the transition to main menu
same as above but for player 2

here we just check if player 1 lives is 0 and health is less or equal to 0
then we fade the main must on channel 0 volume to 0
same as above but here we check if both players are dead

we check if player spawning timer is greater or equal to 0.5seconds
then we subtract 1 from the player lives
and we set the player lives back to 100
and we create the player and its shadow in the collision box position (we create the player at the Y collision box Y position -200, to make the player drop from the sky)
then we change the player animation set to jump at frame 3 (make it looks like hte player is falling)
and we set the player Respawned variable to true
and we plink the player, and we shake the player lives text (so the player notice that his lives changed)
then we delete the timer

for every instane of enemy
we set its variable KnockdownFromPlayerRespawn set to True (to knockdown all enemies when the player respawn)
and we add 1 to the knockdown count and start the enemy timer

whenever the player has respawned (variable is true)
and if the player is on floor, then we set the respawned variable back to false
same as above but for player 2

we check, if the player health is less or equal to 0, and the player is not knocked down (variable is false)
then we start the timer of player and we set the player knockdown variabel to True

if player is knockeddown (variable is true)
then we change the animation of the player to Hurt, and its z order to 150 (on top of all objects)

now we pick the enemy that is the last one attacked the player (variable is true)
and we check if the player is not dead (variable is false)

now we check, if the enemy center x position is greater than player center x position (menas the enemy is on the right side of the player)
then we simulate jump for player 1
and we dont flip ir horizontally
then we start the player timer to KnockDownToLeft (because the enemy is on the right side)
and we start a timer to stop the knockdown of the player
and we rotate the player to -90 (game feel)
and we set the player variable Died to True

same as above, but here we set the player timer KnockDownToRight, because the enemy is on the left side of the player
and we rotate the player 90 degree not -90 like above (it is different because the player here is flipped, while on above event is not)
if the player timer "KnockedDownToRight" is less than 0.56 then we keep moving the player to right (the longer the timer, the more the player will keep moving)
same as above but here we move the player to left
if any of the timers is less than 0.3seconds, we move the player down (game feel, to make the player look like hes falling, not just move right/left and down)

if any of the timers is greater or equal to 0.56seconds
then we shake the player Y position and delete the player shadow (htis mean the player is now on the floor)
here we just create an effect right below the player (using shockwave extensio behavior), game feel
same as above but for player 2

for stage 1 enemies, at the beginning of the scene, we create 2 enemies objects on the right side of the screen
and we set the enemy variable to randomInRange between 5 and 9 (this variable is used to check how many hits the enemy should take before knockdown)
and we set the focus on player 1 (since this is 1 player mode)
and we make sure to disable the platfomrer behavior on enemy

same as above, but we spawn more than 2 enemies
and we check if player is at stage 2
same as above, but here we spawn enemies from the garage at stage 3
same as above
Same as above, but here we set it for 2 players mode (enemy variable "FocusOnPlayer1OrPlayer2" is set to random in range 1,2) (to make the enemies attack either player 1 or player 2)

for evenry instances of enemy object
if the variable is false (we use this variable to trigger this event once for every enemy)
and enemy animation is Move, at frame 2
then we create the dust particles at enemy position
and we set the variable to true

when the variable is true and the enemy animaiton is not Move, or its Moe but not at frame 2,
then we set the enemy variable to false
for each instances of enemy

if the enemy dont have a shadow (variable is false)
we create a shadow at enemy position
and we link the shadow to the enemy
and we set the variable to true

if the variable is true
we take into account the shadow linked to the enemy

here we check
if the eemy is not knocked down
then we change the poxition of the shadow on X and Y to enemy position
same as above, but here we check if the enemy is knocked down, then we only change the shadow X position (we dont want the shadow to change Yposition while the enemy is knocked down)
for each instances of enemy, we change the Z order of the enemy, set to enemy bottom

for each instance of enemy
if the enemy is not taking damage, and not knocked down
and enemy animation is not Punch/hurt/dead1/2

if enemy speed is not equal to 0 (means the enemy is moving)
then we change the enemy animation to Move

if enemy speed is equal to 0 (means the enemy is not moving)
then we change the enemy animation to Idle

for each instance of enemy
if the enemy is not taking damage (variable is false)
and enemy animation is not Dead1/2
and is not dead (variable is false)
same as above, but for player 2
if the enemy focus variable is equal to 1 (means the enemy is focusing on player 1)
if the enemy focus variable is equal to 2 (means the enemy is focusing on player 2)
for each instances of enemy, if enemy is taking damage (variable is true)

enemy healthbar is not created under player 1 (variable is false)
and number of picked enemy is equal to 1 (we use this condition to pick 1 enemy at a time)
then we create the enemy profile picture and health bar under the player UI
and we link them to the enemy, then we set the variable to true (to make this event run once for every enemy)

for each instances of enemy
we take into account the healthbar linked to the enemy
and we check if the health bar of the enemy is not equal to enemy health variable
and the healthbar is greater than 0 (no need to run this event if the enemy healht is 0)
then we change the enemy health bar value set to enemy health variable

this event work as this: if any enemy is taking damage, we show his healthbar, if he is not the one taking damage, then we hide his healthbar
for each instances of enemy
we take into account enemy healthbar and profile picture linked to enemy
if this is not the last attacked enemy, then we hide that enemy healthbar and profile picture
same as above but for both players 1 and 2

we added the X position condition in here, to be able to pick the healthbar created udner player 1 (without this conditions, the game will show/hide enemy health bar under player 2 and 1, which is wrong)

events.name: From punch and floor kicks count

events.comment:
for each instances of enemy
if the number of variable of the enemy is greater or equal than enemy variable
and enemy is not knockeddown (variable is false)
and enemy is not knockeddown from respawn (variable is false)
then we set the enemy knockdown variable to true

for each instance of enemy
if enemy health variable is less or equal to 0
and enemy is not dead (variable is false)

if enemy is not knocked down
we take innto account enemy profile picture and health bar
then we change the enemy knockdown variable to True
and we start the timer for death effect
and we set the enemy variable Dead to True
and we delete both enemy profile picture and health bar

if enemy is knocked down
we take innto account enemy profile picture and health bar
we start the timer for death effect
and we set the enemy variable Dead to True
and we delete both enemy profile picture and health bar

For each instances of enemy
if the enemy is dead (variable is true)

enemy timer is greater than 1.5seconds
then we set the enemy random death sound effect set to random in range 1,2 (to make the enemy make random death sound effect)
then we flash the enemy for 1.2seconds (using flash extension)
then we start the flash timer for enemy
and we delete the death effect timer

if the enemy random sound effect is equal to 1
we play enemy death 1 sound effect and we set hte variable back to 0 (to trigger this event once)

if the enemy random sound effect is equal to 2
we play enemy death 2 sound effect and we set hte variable back to 0 (to trigger this event once)

when the enemy effect timer is greater or equal to 1.5seconds
we take into account the shadow linked to enemy
then we delete the shaodw and increase the variable (NumberOfDeadEnemies) by 1
and delete the enemy

for each instances of enemy
if the enemy timer is greater or euqla to 0.8seconds 
and enemy health variable is greater than 0
then we enable the enemy pathfinding behavior and we move the enemy to its position (to make sure to stop the enemy from moving)
and we set the enemy animation to idle
and number of hit till the enemy get knocked down set to random (means each time the enemy get knockeddown, it will change how many hits its going to take to knock down that enemy again to random in range 5,9)
then we delete the enemy timer

for each instances of enemy
if enemy is knocked down (variable is true)

we move the enemy to its position (to stop the enemy from moving)
then we enable hte enemy platformer object
and change the enemy animation to Dead1

we check if enemy center x position is greater than player center x position (means the enemy is on the right side of player)
and enemy knockdownCount variable is not equal to 0 (to trigger this event once)
then we allow the enemy to jump thne we simulate jump and delete the timer
then we set the enemy taking damage variable to false
and we start the timer (ToRight) and another timer to stop the knock
and we set the knockdownCount to 0 (to trigger this event once)
same as above but here we start the timer knockdown to Left
Here we just check if the timer of enemy is less than 0.56seconds, we move the enemy to right
same as above, but here we move the enemy to left

when the enemy Stop knockdown timer is greater or equal to 0.56
then we turn the enemy platformer behavior off
and set the enemy animation to Dead2
and set the enemy knockdown variable to false
and we create the falling effect (using shockwave extension behavior)
then we start the enemy timer to get up and then we delete all other timers from the enemy and we shake the enemy on Y position (game feel)

Exactly the same as above, but the difference is, rather than checking if Enemy center X positon is greater than player center x position,
we check if enemy center x positon is greater than camera center x position
same as above but for 2 players

events.name: Check if enemy is close to player or not

events.comment: we use this events here, to check if the enemy is close to player or not, then we use that CloseToPlayer variable in the AI actions below, so when the enemy is close to player, then we can perform attack actions, otherwise, move to player position

for each instances of enemy, if the enemy variable is false (we use this variable to check if the enemy is close to player or not)
then we check the player y position is greater and another condition is less than enemy bottom (this conditions is used to make sure the enemy is close to the player on Y position)
then we check if player distances to enemy is below 40 (close to player)
and player is not dead (variable is false)
and player is not jumping (variable is false)
then we set the enemy variable (close to player) set to true
and we set the random movement variable set to 0 (we use this variable to make the enemy AI make random actions, you will see that in the events below)

if player is close to player (boolena is true)
but if the player y position or the distance is not below 40
and player is not dead and not jumping (variables are false)
then we set the enemy variable CloseToPlayer set to false (because now the enemy is not close to the player)
same as above, but here we check if enemy is close to player 2

1/2/3/4/5/6 punch
7 move to radom position
8 idle
for each instances of enemy, if enemy animation is Punch and animation is finished, we set the enemy animation to Idle

if enemy animation is Punch and at frame 2 (we dont want the enemy to damage the enemy while his Arm is still launching on the player, thats why we check if its on frame 2 as well)
and player Y position is close to enemy
and distances between the player and enemy is below 40
and the enemy is not punching player 1 (variable is false)
and player is not dead
then we change player animaiton set to Hurt
and we shake the player on X position (game feel)
and we create damaging effect on the player X,Y position randomly (RandomFloatInRange)
and we subtract 5 from player 1 health
and we set the enemy variable to True (Punching player 1) (to trigger this event once every punch)
and we set the enemy variable to true to check that this is the last enemy attacked the player
and we set the scene variable to true to trigger the event to check which enemy punched the player (refer to "Player mechanics → Damaging enemies → Who is the last enemy that punched the player")
then we start timer for player (we use this timer to finish the Hurt animation so player can move again after taking damage)

when player animation is hurt, and timer is greater or equal to 0.5seconds
we change the player animation to Idle
and delete the player timer
same as above but for 2 players

for each instance of enemy
if enemy is close to player (variable is true)
and enemy is not taking damage and not knocked down (variables are false)
then every time (enemy randomMovement variable) seconds has passed, of that enemy
and the enemy health is greater than 0 (not dead)
and enemy animation is not Punch/dead1/2
then we set the enemy action to randomInRnage between 1 and 8

we use this variable as this:
1/2/3/4/5/6 = make enemy punch
7 move enemy to radom position on the map
8 idle (dont do anything, to give the player chance to fight back)

and then we set the randomMovement variable to randomFloatInRange between 0.3 and 0.7 (so each enemy will have random time to take an action)

here we check if enemy variable is equal to 1 or 2/3/4/5/6 (we used this 6 numbers here, to give the enemy big chance to punch the player)
then we set the Punching player 1 variable to false and we move the enemy to its position (we use htis action to stop the enemy from moving)
then we change the enemy animation to Punch

events.name: Move to random position on the map part

events.comment: here we check, if enemy action variable is equal to 7

then we check, if player is at stage 1/2/3/4 and based on that, we move the enemy to random position on that stage (we check at which stage the player is, to not make the enemy move to random position outside the player stage)
same as above, but here we check for 2 players, and we add the variable (FocusOnPlayer1OrPlayer2 set to 1 if focusing on player 1 and set to 2 if focusing on player 2)

events.name: Move to random position on the map part

events.comment: same as above, but here we check for 2 players, and we add the variable (FocusOnPlayer1OrPlayer2 set to 1 if focusing on player 1 and set to 2 if focusing on player 2)

events.name: Move to random position on the map part

events.comment:
same as above but here we check if the enemy variable (close to player) is false (means the enemy is not close to player)
and the variable (ActionToDo) we set it to RandomInRange between 1 and 4
1/2 move enemy to player
3 move enemy to random position

events.name: Move to random position on the map part

events.comment:
this event is used in 2 players mode only
every 8 seconds for every instances of enemy
we set the randomMovement set to 0 (enemy will pick a new action every 8 seconds)
and here, we check if both players are alive (variables are false) then we set the enemy focus variable on random 1 or 2 (so the enemy will either focus on player 1 or 2)
same as bove, but here we check if player 1 is dead and player 2 is alive, then we make the enemy always focus on player 2
same as bove, but here we check if player 1 is alive and player 2 is dead, then we make the enemy always focus on player 1
same events from "1 Player" group event above, but here we check for 2 players

events.name: Move to random position on the map part
Move to random position on the map part

events.comment:
for each instances of barrel
if the barrel health variable is not equal to 0
and barrel animation is Taking damage, and aniamtion has finished
then we set the barrel animation back to idle

if player animation is Punch1/2 or kick at frame 2
and player distance to barrel is below 40
and player Y position is close to barrel Y position
and barrel can take damage (variable is false)
and the barrel health is not equal to 0
then we change the barrel animation to taking damage, and we shake the barrel on the X position
and we create the damage effect (using shockwave extension behavior) on randomFloatInRange around the barrel (game feel)
and we subtract 1 form theb arrel health variable 
and we set the barrel CantTakeDamage variable to True (to trigger this event once every punch)
and we set the barrel variable to 1 (to check that this barrel is taking damage from player 1)

here we check, if the barrel health variable is less or equal to 0
and the barrel is taking damage from player 1

we check if the player center X position is less than barrel center X position (means the player is on the left side of the parrel)
thne we change the barrel animation set to Broke
and create the apple on the barel position
and add force to the barrel at angle 0
then we wait 0.07s (to give time for the barrel to move)
then we stop the barrel, and we wait 0.4seconds (game feel) then we flash the barrel for 1 secon, and after 1 second, we delete the barrel
same as above, but here the player is on the right side of the barrel, so in add force action, we add force to theb arrel at the angle 180
same as above but for player 2

if J key is pressed
and distance between player and apple is below 20
and player is on floor
then we create the apple particles effect on the apple position
and we add 20 to player health
then we delete the apple
if player health is greater than 100, we set it back to 100 (this event is here to make sure the apple does not increase the player health more than 100, and if it did, the health will back to 100)
same as above but for player 2
if the game has finished
we keep moving the players to right (1 player if user is in 1 player mode, and move 2 players if user is in 2 players mode)
once the game has finished, we flip both players to the right side

when the player x position is greater or equal to 2592 (means the player is at the right side of final stage)
then we set game finished victory variable to false (to stop the player from moving)
then we create all objects related to victory menu

same as above, but here we check which player is alive to move
here we check if both players are alive (variables are false)
then we check if both players x position is greater or equal to 2592
same as above but here we check if player 1 is dead and player 2 is alive
same as above but here we check if player 2 is dead and player 1 is alive

if player is at stage 4 (final stage)
and number if killed enemis are 22 (means the player has killed all enemies, and its victory now)
then we fade the main music volume to 0
and we play victory sound
and we set GameStarted variable to false (to disable all player actions and controls)
and GameFinishedVictory to true
then we pick the wall that is on the right side of stage 4 and delete it (so the players can move to the right side of the final stage (stage 4))

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: EllipseMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move objects on ellipses or smoothly back and forth in one direction.
description: It allows objects to move:
- on an ellipsis or arcs
- smoothly vertically or horizontally (by setting one radius to 0)
- on a sine wave (by adding a force)
It can be used for:
- Making objects float, such as powerups or coins
- Moving platforms
- Enemy movement patterns
- Making a player constantly turn right or left ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://star-seeker))

Update the movement angle for the next frame.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Westboy31
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: FlashTransitionPainter
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Behavior for shape painter allows you to paint a color all over the screen for period of time with an effect (useful for simulate flash and transition effect).
description: * __Paint effect:__ Action to paint a color all over the screen for a period of time with specific effect.
effect type:
* __Flash:__ is a monochrome color appear with fade then disappear with fade out.
* __Vertical:__ is a monochrome color comes from right side then comes back.
* __Horizontal:__ is a monochrome color come from top side then comes back.
* __Circular:__ is a circle which increases from the center and narrows.
* __Paint effect ended:__ event when the paint effect ends.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Paint all over the screen a color for a period of time.

from left to right

from top to bottom

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Entropy, VegeTato
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Flash
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Make an object flash visibility (blink), color tint, object effect, or opacity (fade).
description: Make an object flash for a period of time so that it alternates between two different states.
Includes the ability to flash visibility (blink), color tint, object effect, or opacity (fade).
After adding a behavior to an object, you **trigger the effect** by using the **Flash action**.
This can be used to:
- Let players know they are invincible after being hit
- Catch player attention on the interface (for instance a "press start" text)

eventsFunctions.description: Blend two RGB colors by applying a weighted mean.
eventsFunctions.name: RgbMean

inlineCode: // split do allocations, but the code a lot simpler this way.
const r = gdjs.evtTools.common.clamp(Math.round((1 - ratio) * r1 + ratio * r2), 0, 255);
const g = gdjs.evtTools.common.clamp(Math.round((1 - ratio) * g1 + ratio * g2), 0, 255);
const b = gdjs.evtTools.common.clamp(Math.round((1 - ratio) * b1 + ratio * b2), 0, 255);
console.error("Unable to convert a color: ", e);

parameters.longDescription: Range: 0 to 1, where 0 gives the first color and 1 gives the second color

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ShakeObject
description: Shake an object (position, angle or scale).
It can be used for:
- Hit or impact
- Object slowly rocking back and forth (like a ship)
- Simulate engine vibration, earthquake, or pulsing
The top-down RPG example uses this extension for damage animations ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-rpg)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle).
This behavior can be used on any type of object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle

eventsFunctions.description: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle). Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters.
eventsFunctions.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake object _PARAM0_ for _PARAM2_ seconds. Modify position amplitude _PARAM3_ on X axis and _PARAM4_ on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM5_.  Wait _PARAM6_ seconds between shakes. Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM7_

events.comment: Start/Reset duration timer
Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake
Detect initial shake
Initiate the onScenePostEvents function

parameters.description: Amplitude of postion shake in X direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of position shake in Y direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.longDescription: Use a negative number to make the single-shake move in the opposite direction.
parameters.name: PowerY

parameters.description: Amplitude of angle rotation shake (in degrees)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerAngle

parameters.description: Amount of time between shakes (in seconds) (Default: 0.08)
parameters.longDescription: For a single-shake effect, set it to the same value as "Duration".
parameters.name: TimeBetweenShakes

events.comment: Keep object shaking forever (if desired)
Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Reset drift detection variables
Calculate Position Shake
PositionDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude * [-1 or 1]
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Calculate Rotation (angle) shake
Every "even" shake, rotate clockwise
AngleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude
Every "odd" shake, rotate counter-clockwise
AngleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Change position
Save movement to calculate drift
Change angle
Save movement to calculate drift
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Change position
Save movement to calculate drift
Change angle
Save movement to calculate drift
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Reset drift detection variables

eventsFunctions.description: Stop any shaking of object that was initiated by the Shake Object extension.
eventsFunctions.name: StopShaking

eventsFunctions.description: Check if an object is shaking.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Check if an object is shaking
eventsFunctions.name: IsShaking

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, scale)
This behavior can only be used on sprite objects.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngleScale

eventsFunctions.description: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, scale). Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters.
eventsFunctions.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngleScale
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake object _PARAM0_ for _PARAM2_ seconds. Modify position amplitude _PARAM3_ on X axis and _PARAM4_ on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM5_, and scale amplitude _PARAM6_.  Wait _PARAM7_ seconds between shakes.  Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM8_

events.comment: Start/Reset duration timer
Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake
Detect initial shake
Initiate the onScenePostEvents function

parameters.description: Amplitude of postion shake in X direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of position shake in Y direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.longDescription: Use a negative number to make the single-shake move in the opposite direction.
parameters.name: PowerY

parameters.description: Amplitude of angle rotation shake (in degrees)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerAngle

parameters.description: Amplitude of scale shake (in percent change)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerScale

parameters.description: Amount of time between shakes (in seconds) (Default: 0.08)
parameters.longDescription: For a single-shake effect, set it to the same value as "Duration".
parameters.name: TimeBetweenShakes

events.comment: Keep object shaking forever (if desired)
Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Reset drift detection variables
Calculate Position Shake
PositionDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude * [-1 or 1]
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Calculate Rotation (angle) shake
Every "even" shake, rotate clockwise
AngleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude
Every "odd" shake, rotate counter-clockwise
AngleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude
Calculate Scale shake
Calculate object scale displacement, with linear decay over time
ScaleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude *  1/100
Every even shake, increase scale
Every "odd" shake, decrease scale
ScaleDisplacement = -1 * (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude *  1/100
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Change position
Save movement to calculate drift
Change angle
Save movement to calculate drift
Change scale
Save movement to calculate drift
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Change position
Save movement to calculate drift
Change angle
Save movement to calculate drift
Change scale
Save movement to calculate drift
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

events.comment: This allows to detect a change of "intial value" on hot reload.
Create the child-object instances.
Create the label over the bar.
Pass the configuration to the behavior.

Children instances must be resized when the parent size change:
- background is resized to take the full dimensions of the parent
- the bar size is refreshed according to the value
- the label is put back at the center of the bar

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctions.description: Center the bar according to the button configuration. This is used in doStepPostEvents when the button is resized.
